clear.name: Clear
clear.help: Enter [red]clear[/red] to clear the output from previous commands and messages if they start taking too much space or memory.

helper.name: Help
helper.description: Provides information about available commands and their usage.
helper.help: Use [red]help[/red] to get information on all commands or provide a command name to get detailed usage instructions.

add_cred.name: Add Credentials
add_cred.description: Register login and password data to the database.
add_cred.help: Use [red]add_cred[/red] to add a new login and password combination to the database.

rmv_cred.name: Remove Credentials
rmv_cred.help: Use [red]rmv_cred[/red] to remove a specific set of login credentials from the database.

recover_pw.name: Recover Password
recover_pw.description: Recovers a specific password from the database.
recover_pw.help: Use [red]recover_pw[/red] to recover a specific password from the database by providing the necessary parameters.

rmv_pw.name: Remove Password
rmv_pw.description: Delete a specific password from the database.
rmv_pw.help: Use [red]rmv_pw[/red] to remove a specific password from the database by providing the necessary parameters.

ls_cred.name: List Credentials
ls_cred.description: Displays all existing credential groups in the database.
ls_cred.help: Use [red]ls_cred[/red] to return the list of credential groups (keys) stored in the database.

ls_pws.name: List Passwords
ls_pws.description: Displays all passwords stored under a specific group.
ls_pws.help: Use [red]ls_pws[/red] to list all passwords stored under a specified group. Provide the group name as a parameter.

ls_crypto.name: List Cryptographic Methods
ls_crypto.description: Displays all cryptographic methods available and their associated IDs.
ls_crypto.help: Use [red]ls_crypto[/red] to list all encryption methods and their IDs for usage.

get_strength.name: Get Password Strength
get_strength.description: Given a password, returns its calculated strength based off of industry standards criterias.
get_strength.help: Use [red]get_strength[/red] to calculate the strength of given password

get_pw.name: Generate Password
get_pw.description: Given a certain length, returns a secure password
get_pw.help: Use [red]get_strength[/red] to generate a secured password

search_by_field.name: Search By Field
search_by_field.description: Given a certain data, returns the entire data tile associated, either from login, password or label.
search_by_field.help: Use [red]search_by_field[/red] to return the entire data tile from either a login, password or label

restart_shell.name: Restart Program
restart_shell.description: Restarts the current python CMD shell
restart_shell.help: Use [red]restart_shell[/red] to restart the entire program. More useful for developers. Useful when having to make quick changes and apply them without manually restarting the program.

hello_world.name: Hello World
hello_world.description: Displays hello world with 2 numbers on the screen!
